title: Voting guide: Here’s what voters need to know before Boston’s Tuesday election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston polls open 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. in 275 precincts for the municipal election.
Mayor Michelle Wu is unopposed; City Council races include four at-large seats and contested district seats.
Ballots available in multiple languages; mail-in voters track ballots online, 22 drop boxes available citywide.

title: The Bruins’ second line is looking like a difference-maker, in more ways than one
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Casey Mittelstadt and Viktor Arvidsson propel the Bruins' second line, scoring in a 2-1 win against the Hurricanes.
The Bruins' second line outscored opponents 4-2 in 66 minutes, boosting their offense during Elias Lindholm's absence.
Coach Marco Sturm focuses on player development, with recent healthy scratches leading to improved performance on ice.

title: Garrett Crochet, Roman Anthony named finalist for Cy Young, Rookie of the Year Awards
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Garrett Crochet of the Boston Red Sox is a finalist for the AL Cy Young Award, leading with 255 strikeouts and a 2.59 ERA.
Detroit's Tarik Skubal and Houston's Hunter Brown join Crochet as Cy Young finalists; the winner will be announced on MLB Network.
Red Sox rookie Roman Anthony, with a .292 average and 8 home runs in 71 games, is a finalist for AL Rookie of the Year.

title: Ranking top priorities for Patriots at NFL trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots are focusing on acquiring an edge rusher to bolster their pass-rushing capabilities before the trade deadline.
Patriots are also seeking depth at running back and wide receiver due to current injuries in those positions.
The team's leadership considers options like Arden Key and Jerome Ford to address roster deficiencies effectively.

title: Patriots’ pass-protection issues are mounting as Drake Maye ties worrisome stat from last year
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' quarterback Drake Maye was sacked six times in Sunday's win against the Falcons, totaling 34 sacks this season.
New England's offensive line struggles as they rank second in the NFL for sacks allowed, with 12 in the past two games.
Patriots center Garrett Bradbury emphasized the need for better protection to reduce sacks and improve overall offensive performance.

title: Downtown Boston hotel settles discrimination complaint after woman was accused of being a man
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Liberty Hotel settled with Massachusetts Commission Against Discrimination after security guard wrongly accused Ansley Baker of being a man.
The hotel agreed to a $10,000 donation and will update nondiscrimination policies, while Ansley Baker plans to file a civil lawsuit.
The incident at a Kentucky Derby party led MCAD to accuse the hotel of stereotyping and retaliation, prompting apologies and policy changes.

title: Falcons coach walks back ‘clapgate’ accusations after Patriots push back
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Falcons coach Raheem Morris retracts claims of Patriots simulating snap count after a 24-23 loss to New England.
Morris initially accused Patriots of mimicking Atlanta QB Michael Penix Jr.'s clap, causing a 10-yard grounding penalty.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel denied any wrongdoing, calling the accusations a misunderstanding of loud fan noise.

title: Alex Bregman opts out of Red Sox contract, will hit free agency
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Bregman opts out of Red Sox contract and will enter free agency this offseason.
Bregman had two years and $80 million left on his contract with an opt-out option.
Tigers and Mariners are potential contenders for Bregman, a veteran leader with strong defensive skills.

title: Patriots NFL trade deadline live updates: Will New England make moves before Tuesday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots face decisions before NFL trade deadline with potential to reinforce 7-2 roster for playoff push.
Potential trade targets include Dolphins WR Jaylen Waddle and Saints RB Alvin Kamara, requiring significant assets.
Patriots reportedly shopping OLB Anfernee Jennings, who hasn't started under new defensive staff this season.

title: After an eventful week, Bruins’ Hampus Lindholm has ‘a lot to be thankful for’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm and fiancée Amanda welcomed their first child, Magnolia, last week, inspired by her family's love for the tree.
Lindholm returned to the Bruins' lineup after a lower-body injury; the team is 5-1-0 with him and 2-6-0 without.
Lindholm's presence stabilizes Bruins' defense, allowing a defensive duo of Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov to excel.
